page.title: 20Sugar Beet Factory : York
page.content: York Sugar Beet Factory has been producing sugar since 1926 .The Factory generates its own power by means of generators that burn gas. The sugar beet is grown locally and delivered by road and not rail as in previous years. It takes 12 hours to produce sugar and 650 tonnes a day is produced during the campaign. 100 tonnes of beet produces 15 tonnes of sugar. White sugar only is made in this factory and molasses and beet pulp for animal feed is also made. After the sugar is processed it is taken to supermarkets, retail outlets and factories. During the off season 280 people work in the factory and 460 during the campaign. In the campaign the factory is open 7 days a week and 5 days in the off season. 78000 tonnes of sugar is produced in the factory each year.
